plan: Given the value of A is less than B, I will bid higher for B and slightly lower for A. Initially, I might start my bids at 50% of their respective values and gauge the competitiveness. Later, I will adjust my bids based on the outcome of previous rounds, potentially using an aggressive strategy by bidding up to 100% of their values if I observe low competition. Lastly, I will also explore bidding near my values for AB combined if I continue to win A and B individually at attractively low prices, thus maximizing long-term profit.

My first strategy is to bid my full value for item A, which is a strong option for me. I'll bid relatively low for item B, to understand other bidders' interest. If unsuccessful, I'll increase my bid for B in subsequent rounds. If I'm consistently winning A, I'll lower my bid slightly to optimize profit. Alternatively, I'll consider a package bidding strategy with my full value for A and B combined, testing if higher overall bid could win both. I'll adjust these strategies based on observed bidding behaviour and maintain focus on maximizing my overall profit.

I plan to split my bid based on the proportion in which I value goods A and B. Considering the values for A (22) and B (2), I'd put a higher bid on A than B. Also, I'd try an aggressive strategy, bidding near my maximum value for A, while minimal for B. However, to account for the substantial combined value, I'd also bid for 'AB' aggressively. As per historical data, If standard bidding doesn't work or competition is high, I plan to bid significantly above my value, making it risky yet potentially profitable.

To maximize profit, consider a split bid strategy - bid 100% of the value for the highly valued item B and around 50% value for A. Adjust in future rounds based on competition level and outcome, testing a range from 50% to 100%.

This round, I plan to bid $7 for A and $4 for B as a preliminary test. I will also experiment bidding $29 on the combo, to judge competitors' interest. Based on the results, I'll adjust my strategies in subsequent rounds for profit maximization.

Plan to bid aggressively for both A and B given their high values, while maintaining a keen eye on the profit margin. This could involve bidding slightly less than my value for each. Reflect on results to adjust future bids and strategies accordingly.

For the next round, I plan to bid 90% of my valuation for item A and 100% for item B. I will also explore placing a bid for AB combined near my values if I continue to win items at lower prices to maximize profit.

This round, I'll increase my bids to $10 for A and $5 for B. As per calculation, my doubled combined value is 38 which is suitable to bid for package AB to know competitors' interest. I'll keep adapting my strategy, aiming for profit maximization.

I plan to bid less than my values for A and B, giving priority to B. For combined goods, I'll bid aggressively, expecting the overall value to be high. I'll experiment reducing bid incrementally for A and check profits.
